tune.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
tune.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
The song was sung to the tune of ‘Amazing Grace’.
tune.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He played a tune on the piano.
She was humming a little tune to herself.
They wrote many great tunes together in the 80s.
His songs have simple words and catchy tunes.
the theme tune from the movie 'Titanic'
The DJ played some bouncy dance tunes.
tune.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch
tune.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
tune.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make small changes to an engine so that it works as well as possible
tune.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to make a radio or television receive broadcasts from a particular place
tune.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The radio was tuned to a classical station.
tune.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used to emphasize how large an amount or number is
tune.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The company is in debt to the tune of £1.2 billion.
